qa_pairs.question: what are your plans about Crux, which you acquired recently?
qa_pairs.answer: I acquired Crux to develop it as a platform for use. I want people visiting Ergo first to visit Crux Finance, but I'll make it use-centric with use as the main trading pair. I'll build a bank monitor there so people can see how bank reserves behave over time to give confidence that use is fully collateralized.

qa_pairs.question: Joe, so what's Rosen-Lithos projects you are involved with done in 2025?
qa_pairs.answer: Lithos launched its first version of Testnet after 2-3 years with decent participation. We're getting ready to release the third version with additional fraud proofs and optimization. It's designed to solve the pooling problem in proof of work by democratizing mining - replacing centralized pools with smart contracts that enforce honesty.

qa_pairs.question: Richard, as far as I know, all your plans for use also BSC centric, right?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, on January 1st we will have first bridged use and use USDT pair with concentrated liquidity on Binance chain. Some miners expressed excitement that they can mine directly on their Ergo wallet and transfer with Rosen Bridge in a 100% decentralized way to cash out on USDT, bypassing centralized exchanges.
